title: Cuomo, Krugman and Kentucky
sub_head: New York Times columnist exploits tragedy to recycle dubious claim.
body:
“On a single Kentucky street, the tornado killed 7 children,” reads the headline on an Associated Press story today. The AP’s Claire Galofaro and John Raby report from Bowling Green:
Statewide, the death toll stands at 71 from last weekend’s tornadoes, with 59 people still unaccounted for, according to a Journal report. Normal human beings who don’t write for the New York Times are naturally responding to this awful news by thinking about the pain endured by the people of Kentucky and perhaps exploring if there is some way to help. But Times columnist Paul Krugman sees a moment to advance his agenda by shaming the victims of the natural disaster for not sharing his leftist ideology. He writes:
